front.title: Quality of Service Extension to IRML

abstract.t: The Intermediary Rule Markup Language (IRML) [2] is an XML-based language that can be used to describe service-specific execution rules for network edge intermediaries under the Open Pluggable Edge Services (OPES) framework, as described in [3] and [4]. This memo illustrates examples of employing the IRML for Quality of Service (QoS) policing and control, and proposes a QoS sub-system extension to IRML for better QoS support in the OPES framework.
